review_details:
Inexpensive cosy taverna on the way back from Spartia beach.
Fish comes from the family's fisherman boat, and is as fresh as you could possibly imagine. We ate there two days in a row feeding outselves on fried calamaris and anchovies, and grilled bream and bass. Not to mention a delicious mussel saganaky, probably the best i had in years.
After only one week, I miss it already... :)

The best mussaka ever.
(we liked other dishes too, but the mussaka is unbelievable).
Friendly atmosphere.

thanks to Antonia, her family and Mustapha we spent an unusual and relaxing day on their fishing boat.
the tour took almost one day (abour 8 am to 4 pm) and consisted on a beautiful sail along the coast near Spartia, till the place where the nets were pulled (which in itself is something you don't see everyday) and again to a secluded beach where we had plenty of time for swimming waiting for the fish jush catched to be cooked :)
Never in my life I had fish so fresh and juicy, I felt like Gollum ;)
But most important of all is the nice, friendly and warm hospitality Antonia and all the family granted us and the other people on the boat that day. That helped all of us to mingle and relax together and contributed a lot to the whole success of the expedition.

Abbiamo provato questo ristorante per la prima volta l'estate scorsa, e da allora ci siamo tornati altre volte senza mai restare delusi.
Il pezzo forte sono senz'altro gli antipasti, una bella varietà di specialità di mare, ma anche il resto è di ottima qualità (noi nelle varie volte abbiamo provato la frittura di pesce, la grigliata, gli spaghetti alle vongole e il trancio di pesce al sale).
Vino della casa e grappa di ottimo livello completano il quadro.
A chi rimane spazio consiglio anche i dolci della casa.
Ma soprattutto consiglio di farsi consigliare dal patron, attento e mai invadente.

reviewTitle: Un angolo di benessere a Lambrate
review_details:
Andando nel tardo pomeriggio si trova poco affollato e l'ambiente tiepido e accogliente. Il tepidarium con i datteri e il the alla menta ti prepara al bagno turco e al gommage con il sapone d'Aleppo. Poi idromassaggio, massaggio con olio d'argan (meraviglioso!) e relax nella sala divani con adiacente un piccolo buffet di snack maghrebini (olive, hummus, pomodorini).
Un'esperienza molto positiva, una coccola di 3 ore che ti fa uscire rinfrancato e sorridente.

I definitely do not recommend this resto.
Starting from the staff, at least unprofessional and, except one case, even impolite. A general lack in management, resulting in 35 minutes waiting between starters and first course (got it only upon complain to the staff) and three different persons attending our table during the dinner (two of us, 2 starters, 2 first, 1 wine + water, 2 desserts).
The worse happened after having paid the bill: I started feeling bad, and asked for some warm lemonade. I got it indeed but no one even asked me how I was feeling and if I needed any help. Even after 15 minutes disappearance in the bathroom and my fiancé asking for more lemonade, yet again no one thought to care about me. Probably if I hadn’t paid, more people would come and see…

Food is good, but not as good as to justify such a poor service.
